document.docAuthor: Luna-Cozar, Jesús, Anderson, Robert S., Jones, Robert W. & León-Cortés, Jorge L.
document.docTitle: Tylodinus variabilis Luna-Cozar & Anderson & Jones & León-Cortés 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic monograph of the genus Tylodinus Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Cryptorhynchinae: Tylodina) of Chiapas, Mexico

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic monograph of the genus Tylodinus Champion (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Cryptorhynchinae: Tylodina) of Chiapas, Mexico

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Length male, 3.4–4.0 mm, female, 3.2–4.0 mm. Width male, 1.6–1.7 mm , female 1.5–2.0 mm. As for
T. buchanani
with the follow exceptions: body clothed with short scales, light scales on vertex and pronotum frequently whitish, but in some specimens light brown. Head with overlapping scales on vertex; front moderately concave. Elytra with basal margin straight ( Figure 2 ), stria 10 complete, surface granulate, tubercles similar to
T. buchanani
. Metasternal tooth absent. Abdomen squamous, scales setigerous, ventrite 1 convex; ventrite 2 longer than 3–4 combined, convex. Hind femora length almost reaching elytral apex, front tibiae sinuate, middle and hind tibiae subparallel, premucro very small, hind tibiae with apical ¼ curved. Male genitalia ( Fig. 107 ) in lateral view slender; in ventral view with lateral sides concave, subparallel; apical process in lateral view weakly curved. Female genitalia with tergite eight trapezoidal, apex slightly curved, sternite eight oblong, median membranous area subapical; spermatheca shallowly curved, ramus long and slender, nodulus slender.
Habitat and elevation. Specimens were collected from leaf litter in high elevation cloud forest between 2300–2750 m .

Derivation of specific name. Name derived from the Latin word
variabilis
= variable.

Material examined .
